intro: Jatropha costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican jatropha, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Jatropha costaricensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
